title: Relates to limited-profit housing companies
summary: Relates to limited-profit housing companies; authorizes certain companies to pay dividends or interest in excess of six percent per annum; relates to the dissolution of certain rental housing companies.

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 19, 2011

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. V. LOPEZ, CYMBROWITZ, WRIGHT, ORTIZ, ROBINSON,
         O'DONNELL, PERRY, MAYERSOHN, COLTON, BROOK-KRASNY,  SCHROEDER,  ROSEN-
         THAL,  LANCMAN,  MAISEL, KAVANAGH, P. RIVERA, JEFFRIES, TITONE, TITUS,
         CAMARA, SPANO, BARRON -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A.  BING,  DINOW-
         ITZ,  FARRELL,  GLICK,  GOTTFRIED,  HEASTIE,  HEVESI, JACOBS, MILLMAN,
         PHEFFER, TOWNS -- read once and referred to the Committee on Housing

       AN ACT to amend the private housing finance law, in relation  to  limit-
         ed-profit housing companies in a city with a population of one million
         or more

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 28 of the private housing finance law is amended by
    2  adding a new subdivision 4 to read as follows:
    3    4. (A) NOTWITHSTANDING ANY INCONSISTENT PROVISION OF THIS  ARTICLE  OR
    4  OF  ANY  OTHER  PROVISION  OF  GENERAL,  SPECIAL OR LOCAL LAW, A COMPANY
    5  (OTHER THAN A MUTUAL COMPANY) THAT OPERATES A MUNICIPALLY-AIDED  PROJECT
    6  IN A CITY WITH A POPULATION OF ONE MILLION OR MORE AND THAT IS OTHERWISE
    7  AUTHORIZED  TO PAY DIVIDENDS UPON ITS SHARES OR INTEREST UPON ITS INCOME
    8  DEBENTURES MAY, WITH THE APPROVAL OF THE SUPERVISING  AGENCY,  PAY  SUCH
    9  DIVIDENDS OR INTEREST IN EXCESS OF SIX PERCENT PER ANNUM.
   10    (B)  ON  AND AFTER THE DATE OF THE APPROVAL OF SUCH EXCESS DIVIDEND OR
   11  INTEREST BY THE SUPERVISING AGENCY PURSUANT TO  PARAGRAPH  (A)  OF  THIS
   12  SUBDIVISION, THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION THIRTY-ONE OF THIS ARTICLE RELAT-
   13  ING  TO  THE VARIATION OF RENTAL RATES OF DWELLING UNITS IN SUCH MUNICI-
   14  PALLY-AIDED PROJECT SHALL NOT APPLY AND RENTAL RATES OF  DWELLING  UNITS
   15  MAY  BE  INCREASED  ANNUALLY  BY SUCH COMPANY, WITHOUT PUBLIC HEARING OR
   16  FURTHER APPROVAL BY THE SUPERVISING AGENCY, IN THE AMOUNT AUTHORIZED  BY
   17  THE RENT GUIDELINES BOARD ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO THE RENT STABILIZATION
   18  LAW OF NINETEEN HUNDRED SIXTY-NINE FOR RENT STABILIZED DWELLING UNITS.
   19    (C) THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL NOT APPLY TO A COMPANY WITH A MORTGAGE LOAN
   20  INSURED OR HELD BY THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

    1    S  2.  The  private  housing  finance  law  is amended by adding a new
    2  section 35-a to read as follows:
    3    S  35-A.  DISSOLUTION  OF CERTAIN RENTAL HOUSING COMPANIES. 1. FOR THE
    4  PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE FOLLOWING TERMS SHALL  HAVE  THE  MEANINGS
    5  SET FORTH BELOW:
    6    (A)  "AFFECTED  DEVELOPMENT"  SHALL  MEAN  HOUSING  ACCOMMODATIONS (I)
    7  LOCATED IN A CITY WITH A POPULATION OF ONE  MILLION  OR  MORE,  (II)  IN
    8  BUILDINGS  COMPLETED  OR BUILDINGS SUBSTANTIALLY REHABILITATED AS FAMILY
    9  UNITS ON OR AFTER JANUARY  FIRST,  NINETEEN  HUNDRED  SEVENTY-FOUR,  AND
   10  (III)  OPERATED  PRIOR  TO  THE DISSOLUTION DATE AS A RENTAL DEVELOPMENT
   11  PURSUANT TO THIS ARTICLE.
   12    (B) "AFFECTED DWELLING UNIT" SHALL MEAN A DWELLING UNIT IN AN AFFECTED
   13  DEVELOPMENT.
   14    (C) "AFFECTED HOUSING COMPANY" SHALL  MEAN  A  LIMITED-PROFIT  HOUSING
   15  COMPANY WITH AN AFFECTED DEVELOPMENT.
   16    (D) "DISSOLUTION DATE" SHALL MEAN, WITH RESPECT TO ANY AFFECTED DEVEL-
   17  OPMENT,  THE  DATE  OF THE DISSOLUTION OR RECONSTITUTION OF THE AFFECTED
   18  HOUSING COMPANY WITH SUCH AFFECTED DEVELOPMENT PURSUANT TO SECTION THIR-
   19  TY-FIVE OF THIS ARTICLE.
   20    (E) "VOUCHER RECIPIENT" SHALL MEAN A TENANT IN  AN  AFFECTED  DWELLING
   21  UNIT  WHO  RECEIVES  ENHANCED VOUCHER ASSISTANCE PURSUANT TO THE VOUCHER
   22  ACT FOR SUCH PERIOD AS SUCH TENANT RECEIVES SUCH ASSISTANCE.
   23    (F) "VOUCHER UNIT" SHALL MEAN AN AFFECTED DWELLING UNIT THAT IS AT ANY
   24  TIME OCCUPIED BY A VOUCHER RECIPIENT, FOR SUCH PERIOD AS  SUCH  AFFECTED
   25  DWELLING UNIT IS OCCUPIED BY A VOUCHER RECIPIENT.
   26    (G)  "MARKET  UNIT"  SHALL  MEAN  AN AFFECTED DWELLING UNIT THAT IS NO
   27  LONGER SUBJECT TO THE RENT STABILIZATION LAW OF NINETEEN HUNDRED  SIXTY-
   28  NINE  AND  THE  EMERGENCY TENANT PROTECTION ACT OF NINETEEN SEVENTY-FOUR
   29  BECAUSE IT HAS BEEN DECONTROLLED PURSUANT TO THE TERMS OF APPLICABLE LAW
   30  OR PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION THREE OF THIS SECTION.
   31    (H) "VACATED UNIT" SHALL MEAN AN AFFECTED DWELLING UNIT, OTHER THAN  A
   32  VOUCHER  UNIT OR A MARKET UNIT, THAT IS NO LONGER OCCUPIED BY THE TENANT
   33  WHO OCCUPIED SUCH UNIT ON THE DISSOLUTION DATE OR BY THE LAWFUL  SUCCES-
   34  SORS IN INTEREST OF SUCH TENANT.
   35    (I)  "FULLY  TAXABLE  UNITS" SHALL MEAN, WITH RESPECT TO ANY TAX YEAR,
   36  ALL AFFECTED UNITS THAT WERE VOUCHER  UNITS,  MARKET  UNITS  OR  VACATED
   37  UNITS ON THE TAXABLE STATUS DATE OF SUCH TAX YEAR.
   38    (J)  "PARTIALLY  TAXABLE  UNITS"  SHALL  MEAN, WITH RESPECT TO ANY TAX
   39  YEAR, ALL AFFECTED UNITS WHICH WERE NOT FULLY TAXABLE UNITS ON THE TAXA-
   40  BLE STATUS DATE OF SUCH TAX YEAR.
   41    (K) "VOUCHER ACT" SHALL MEAN SECTION 8(T) OF THE UNITED STATES HOUSING
   42  ACT OF NINETEEN THIRTY-SEVEN, AS AMENDED, OR ANY SUCCESSOR STATUTE,  AND
   43  ANY REGULATIONS PROMULGATED THEREUNDER.
   44    2.  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY  PROVISION  TO THE CONTRARY CONTAINED IN THIS
   45  ARTICLE, AND NOTWITHSTANDING THE PROVISIONS OF ANY GENERAL,  SPECIAL  OR
   46  LOCAL  LAW, AFTER THE DISSOLUTION DATE, AFFECTED DWELLING UNITS SHALL BE
   47  FULLY SUBJECT TO THE PROVISIONS OF THE RENT STABILIZATION LAW  OF  NINE-
   48  TEEN HUNDRED SIXTY-NINE AND THE EMERGENCY TENANT PROTECTION ACT OF NINE-
   49  TEEN SEVENTY-FOUR.
   50    (A)  THE  INITIAL  LEGAL REGULATED RENT FOR ANY AFFECTED DWELLING UNIT
   51  FOLLOWING THE DISSOLUTION DATE SHALL BE THE LAST RENT AUTHORIZED FOR THE
   52  AFFECTED DWELLING UNIT BEFORE THE DISSOLUTION DATE, WHICH SHALL  NOT  BE
   53  SUBJECT TO ADJUSTMENT PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION A OF SECTION 26-513 OF THE
   54  ADMINISTRATIVE CODE OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK.
   55    (B) NOTWITHSTANDING ANY PROVISION OF THIS SECTION TO THE CONTRARY, THE
   56  LEGAL  REGULATED  RENT  FOR A VOUCHER UNIT SHALL BE EQUAL TO THE MAXIMUM

       A. 2595                             3

    1  RENT AUTHORIZED AND APPROVED IN CONNECTION WITH THE  FEDERAL  ASSISTANCE
    2  PROVIDED  TO  THE  VOUCHER  RECIPIENT OCCUPYING SUCH VOUCHER UNIT. IF AN
    3  AFFECTED DWELLING UNIT WHICH WAS A VOUCHER UNIT CEASES TO BE  A  VOUCHER
    4  UNIT  AT  ANY TIME OR FOR ANY REASON, EXCEPT FOR THOSE REASONS SPECIFIED
    5  IN SUBDIVISION THREE OF THIS SECTION, THE INITIAL LEGAL  REGULATED  RENT
    6  FOR SUCH AFFECTED DWELLING UNIT FOLLOWING SUCH CHANGE IN STATUS SHALL BE
    7  EQUAL  TO THE SUM OF (I) THE LAST RENT AUTHORIZED BEFORE THE DISSOLUTION
    8  DATE, PLUS (II) ANY ADJUSTMENTS TO SUCH RENT AUTHORIZED BY  LAW  BETWEEN
    9  THE  DISSOLUTION  DATE  AND THE DATE UPON WHICH SUCH UNIT CEASED TO BE A
   10  VOUCHER UNIT.
   11    3. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY PROVISION OF  THIS  SECTION  TO  THE  CONTRARY,
   12  WHERE  AN  AFFECTED  DEVELOPMENT  CONTAINS  DWELLING  UNITS WHICH MAY BE
   13  ELIGIBLE FOR ENHANCED VOUCHER ASSISTANCE PURSUANT TO  THE  VOUCHER  ACT,
   14  ANY  DWELLING  UNIT IN SUCH AFFECTED DEVELOPMENT SHALL BE DEEMED TO BE A
   15  MARKET UNIT AND NOT SUBJECT TO THE RENT STABILIZATION  LAW  OF  NINETEEN
   16  HUNDRED  SIXTY-NINE  AND THE EMERGENCY TENANT PROTECTION ACT OF NINETEEN
   17  SEVENTY-FOUR FOR THE DURATION OF SUCH TENANCY IF: (A) THE TENANT  RESID-
   18  ING IN SUCH DWELLING UNIT AS OF THE DISSOLUTION DATE FAILS TO SUBMIT ALL
   19  OF  THE  REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION FOR THE INITIAL APPLICATION FOR ENHANCED
   20  VOUCHER ASSISTANCE PURSUANT TO THE VOUCHER ACT, (B) A VOUCHER  RECIPIENT
   21  RESIDING  IN  SUCH DWELLING UNIT FAILS TO SUBMIT THE REQUIRED DOCUMENTA-
   22  TION FOR RECERTIFICATION FOR ENHANCED VOUCHER ASSISTANCE PURSUANT TO THE
   23  VOUCHER ACT, OR (C) A VOUCHER RECIPIENT RESIDING IN SUCH  DWELLING  UNIT
   24  VIOLATES,  THROUGH  ACTION  OR INACTION, THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE VOUCHER
   25  ACT. UPON THE FIRST VACANCY OF AN AFFECTED DWELLING UNIT WHICH BECOMES A
   26  MARKET RATE UNIT PURSUANT TO THIS SUBDIVISION,  SUCH  AFFECTED  DWELLING
   27  UNIT  SHALL BE FULLY SUBJECT TO THE PROVISIONS OF THE RENT STABILIZATION
   28  LAW OF NINETEEN HUNDRED SIXTY-NINE AND THE EMERGENCY  TENANT  PROTECTION
   29  ACT  OF  NINETEEN SEVENTY-FOUR, AND THE INITIAL LEGAL REGULATED RENT FOR
   30  SUCH AFFECTED DWELLING UNIT FOLLOWING SUCH CHANGE  IN  STATUS  SHALL  BE
   31  EQUAL  TO THE SUM OF (I) THE LAST RENT AUTHORIZED BEFORE THE DISSOLUTION
   32  DATE, PLUS (II) ANY ADJUSTMENTS TO SUCH RENT AUTHORIZED BY  LAW  BETWEEN
   33  THE  DISSOLUTION  DATE  AND THE DATE UPON WHICH SUCH UNIT CEASES TO BE A
   34  MARKET UNIT.
   35    4. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY PROVISION TO THE  CONTRARY  CONTAINED  IN  THIS
   36  ARTICLE,  AND  NOTWITHSTANDING THE PROVISIONS OF ANY GENERAL, SPECIAL OR
   37  LOCAL LAW, AFTER THE DISSOLUTION DATE, ANY PARTIAL EXEMPTION  FROM  REAL
   38  PROPERTY  TAXATION  GRANTED TO THE REAL PROPERTY IN AN AFFECTED DEVELOP-
   39  MENT PURSUANT TO SECTION THIRTY-THREE OF  THIS  ARTICLE  SHALL  CONTINUE
   40  WITH RESPECT TO ANY PARTIALLY TAXABLE UNITS, BUT ANY FULLY TAXABLE UNITS
   41  SHALL BE SUBJECT TO FULL REAL PROPERTY TAXATION.
   42    5. THIS SECTION SHALL NOT APPLY TO AN AFFECTED DEVELOPMENT IF: (A) THE
   43  OWNER  AND  A  DULY  RECOGNIZED  TENANTS  ASSOCIATION  EXECUTE A WRITTEN
   44  SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT ON OR BEFORE THE DISSOLUTION  DATE,  AND  (B)  SUCH
   45  WRITTEN  SETTLEMENT  AGREEMENT SPECIFIES THE RESPECTIVE RIGHTS AND OBLI-
   46  GATIONS OF THE TENANTS AND OWNER SUBSEQUENT TO THE DISSOLUTION DATE.
   47    S 3. If any clause, sentence, paragraph, section or part of  this  act
   48  shall  be adjudged by any court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid,
   49  such judgment shall not affect,  impair,  or  invalidate  the  remainder
   50  thereof, but shall be confined in its operation to the clause, sentence,
   51  paragraph,  section or part thereof directly involved in the controversy
   52  in which judgment shall have been rendered.
   53    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately; provided,  however,  that
   54  section  two  of this act shall apply to any affected development with a
   55  dissolution date on or after the effective date of this act.
